DOCNAME: BERGAUER AND OTHERS v. THE CZECH REPUBLIC
TEXT: The applicants are CARDINAL NORP , NORP or NORP nationals , all of NORP ethnic origin . They or their ancestors were residing in former GPE , from the territory of which they were expelled after the Second World War . Before the ORG they are represented by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE ( GPE ) .

The applicants or their ascendants lost their NORP citizenship as a consequence of LAW ( Mnichovská dohoda ) concluded between GPE , GPE , GPE and GPE on DATE . In DATE border areas of NORP territory , termed by the applicants “ NORP ” , were annexed to GPE under the LAW , on the basis of which CARDINAL NORP citizens were ordered to leave their property and move to the remaining territory of GPE known as GPE . Their real estate was expropriated without compensation .

On DATE the NORP Minister of the Interior adopted an Ordinance on the acquisition of NORP citizenship by former NORP citizens of NORP ethnicity . These persons were collectively made NORP nationals without their consent .

On DATE the NORP territory was liberated and the Government , led by President Mr PERSON , returned from their exile in GPE to re - establish the rule of law after the war . A number of presidential decrees was adopted .

The applicants submit that , during the liberation of GPE and after DATE , they and/or their family ’s predecessors became victims of severe and unjustified ill - treatment . This consisted of , inter alia , various unsubstantiated assaults , individual acts of violence and harassment allegedly committed by members of the NORP partisans’ guards , forcible replacement and internment in inadequate conditions , obligatory labelling of NORP nationals with distinguishing arm bands , forcible evictions , confiscation of movable assets and valuables , and forced labour .

On CARDINAL DATE Presidential Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL on LAW during the period of Lack of Freedom and on ORG , NORP , Traitors and Collaborators , and ORG ( dekret presidenta republiky o neplatnosti některých majetkově - právních jednání z doby nesvobody a o národní správě majetkových hodnot Němců , ORG , zrádců a kolaborantů a některých organisací a ústavů ) entered into force . It provided , inter alia , that “ any form of property transfer and transaction affecting property rights , in terms of movable and immovable assets and public and private property , shall be invalidated if it was adopted after DATE under pressure by the NORP occupation forces or due to national , racial or political persecution ” . Moreover , “ those persons who in any census held after DATE declared themselves to be of NORP or NORP origin , or became members of national groups , formations or political parties , which functioned as associations for persons of NORP or NORP nationality , shall be deemed persons of NORP or NORP nationality ” .

On DATE Presidential Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL on the Confiscation and Accelerated Allocation of the Agricultural Property of NORP , NORP , NORP and Enemies of the NORP and NORP nations ( dekret presidenta republiky o konfiskaci a urychleném rozdělení zemědělského majetku Němců , ORG , jakož i zrádců a nepřátel českého a slovenského národa ) entered into force . It provided for the expropriation , with immediate effect and without compensation , of agricultural property for the purposes of land reform . It concerned any agricultural property , with its attachments - buildings and movable goods - in the ownership of all persons of NORP and NORP origin , irrespective of their citizenship status .

On DATE Presidential Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL on ORG of NORP and NORP Nationality ( dekret presidenta republiky o úpravě československého státního občanství osob národnosti německé a maďarské ) entered into force . On the basis of this decree , the NORP State released from its citizenship those persons who , “ in compliance with the regulations of the foreign occupation forces , had acquired NORP or NORP citizenship ” . NORP citizenship was retained by persons who had demonstrated “ their loyalty to GPE , had never committed any offence against NORP and NORP nationals , and who had either actively participated in the struggle for the liberation of the country , or had suffered under NORP or fascist terror ” . Citizenship was also retained by NORP and NORP who “ in the period of the increased threat to the Republic , officially registered as NORP or NORP ” . A further category provided for people who could apply to recover citizenship within DATE from the date of the publication of the relevant ORG regulation . This group included NORP “ opponents of NORP and NORP ” . Applications for the recovery of NORP citizenship were to be filed with district national committees DATE and DATE .

Following the resolution adopted at ORG with the unanimous consent of ORG , the NORP populations from the territories of GPE , GPE and GPE were moved to GPE . The actual performance and technical modalities of the move were subject to regulation by subordinate legislation ; no particular laws or presidential decrees providing for the execution of the relocation were adopted .

Presidential Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL on the Confiscation of Enemy Property and the National Restoration Funds ( dekret presidenta republiky o konfiskaci nepřátelského majetku a GPE národní obnovy ) entered into force on DATE . It provided for the confiscation of the property of NORP , NORP , traitors and collaborators , and persons with an unreliable attitude to the ORG . However , the property of the people , including NORP and NORP , who took an active part in the fight for the preservation of the territorial integrity and liberation of GPE was not confiscated .
On DATE LAW of the Paris Conference on Reparation ( Dohoda o reparacích od PERSON , o zřízení ORG reparačního úřadu a o vrácení měnového zlata ) established , that :

“ Each of the signatory governments , through the form fixed on its own discretion , will keep NORP enemy property under its authority , or will dispose of it in such a way that it could not return under NORP ownership or control , and will subtract this property from its share of the reparations . ”

On DATE Act No . CARDINAL on ORG in connection with the Struggle to regain the Liberty of the NORP and NORP ( zákon o právnosti jednání souvisících s bojem o znovunabytí svobody Čechů a Slováků ) entered into force . Under section CARDINAL , “ Any act committed DATE and DATE , the object of which was to contribute to the struggle for the liberty of NORP and NORP , or which represented just reprisals for actions of the occupation forces and their accomplices , is not unlawful even if it would be punishable under the currently applicable laws . ”

Established in DATE , ad hoc parliamentary committees investigated the circumstances of acts of violence committed after the liberation in DATE , as a result of which a number of criminal proceedings had commenced and continued until DATE , when the democratic constitution of GPE was undermined again .
II . The period shortly before and after DATE , the date of the entry into force of LAW with regard to GPE

On DATE the Extra - Judicial Rehabilitation Act no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL entered into force . The act affirmed the intention to redress the consequences of certain infringements of property and other rights which had occurred DATE . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) , inter alia , provides that , in order to be entitled to the restitution of property , a claimant must be a natural person and a citizen of the NORP and GPE .

On DATE LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL entered into force . It regulates , inter alia , the restitution of certain agricultural and other property , defined in DATE , which was assigned or transferred to the ORG or other legal entity between CARDINAL DATE and DATE . Section CARDINAL ) lists the acts giving rise to a restitution claim . The persons entitled to claim restitution are set out in section CARDINAL which provides , inter alia , that any natural person who is a citizen of the NORP and GPE and who lost property which once formed his or her agricultural homestead in the period from DATE to DATE , in CARDINAL of the ways set out in section CARDINAL ) , is entitled to claim restitution .

On DATE LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL entered into force . It established NORP ( NORP ) citizenship and permanent residence within the NORP territory as the prerequisite conditions for claiming expropriated real estate .
In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG ( PERSON ) abrogated the condition of permanent residence within the territory of GPE , laid down in LAW , for persons claiming restitution .
On DATE ORG dismissed a constitutional appeal ( ústavní stížnost ) filed by PERSON who had sought to repeal Presidential Decree No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL . It stated in particular :

“ ( ... ) since the enemy occupation of the NORP territory by the armed forces of the PERSON had made it impossible to assert the sovereign ORG power which sprang from LAW of GPE , introduced by LAW no . CARDINAL , as well as from the whole NORP legal order , LAW , set up in GPE , must be looked upon as the internationally recognised legitimate constitutional authority of the NORP State . In consequence thereof and as a result of their ratification by ORG . CARDINAL of DATE , all normative acts of LAW are expressions of legal NORP ( NORP ) legislative power , so that as a result thereof the striving of the nations of GPE to restore the constitutional and legal order of the Republic was achieved . ( ... )

( ... ) it is true in principle that that which emerges from the past must , face to face with the present , pass muster in respect of values ; nevertheless , this assessment of the past may not be merely the present passing judgment upon the past . In other words , the present order , which has been enlightened by subsequent events , draws upon those experiences , and looks upon and assesses a great many phenomena with the advantage of hindsight , may not sit in judgment upon the order which has prevailed in the past . ( ... )

In view of the fact that [ the Decree ] has already accomplished its purposes and for a period of DATE has not created any further legal relations , so that it no longer has any constitutive character , in the given situation its inconsistency with constitutional acts or international treaties ( ... ) can not be reviewed DATE . ”
In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG abrogated the condition of permanent residence within the territory of GPE , laid down in LAW and LAW , for persons claiming restitution .

On DATE Act No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , amending LAW and LAW , entered into force . It amended the condition of permanent residence within the territory of GPE into the condition of lasting NORP ( NORP ) citizenship , and enabled the entitled persons , originally discriminated by the condition of residence , to re - introduce their restitution claim .
In a judgment of DATE ORG ( PERSON ) referred to Presidential Decree No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL as valid legislation .

According to the applicants , this state of law , whereby the Presidential Decrees of DATE were considered a valid part of the national legal system and a condition of lasting citizenship was required for claiming restitution , prevented them from raising their restitution claims before the courts . Due to this discouragingly defined position , they did not attempt to seek either restitution or financial compensation before the national courts , nor did they lodge an appeal or a proposal to repeal particular acts with ORG .

On DATE the NORP - German Declaration regarding ORG and their Future Development ( GPE - německá deklarace o vzájemných vztazích a jejich budoucím rozvoji ; PERSON - tschechische Erklärung über die gegenseitigen PERSON und deren künftige GPE ) was concluded by the respective governments expressing their regret for the grievances arising from the period of CARDINAL–CARDINAL and a determination to maintain good neighbourly relations .

On DATE ORG adopted a resolution providing , inter alia , that “ the legal and property relations resulting therefore [ from the post - war laws and presidential decrees ] are incontestable , unimpeachable and unchangeable . ”
